Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition: spoof vi. To capture, alter, and retransmit a communication stream in a way that misleads the recipient. As used by hackers, refers especially to altering TCP/IP packet source addresses or other packet-header data in order to masquerade as a trusted machine. This term has become very widespread and is borderline techspeak.

spoof n : a composition that imitates somebody's style in a humorous way [syn: {parody}, {lampoon}, {sendup}, {mockery}, {takeoff}, {burlesque}, {travesty}, {charade}, {pasquinade}, {put-on}] v : make a parody of; "The students spoofed the teachers" [syn: {burlesque}, {parody}]
